ICamera.h

This file defines the published interface camera objects

ICamera

The CCamera object defines our camera. We pass this to our IRenderer to determine where to render from.

Header

Rendering/Caustic/ICamera.h

Functions
SetParams
virtual void SetParams(
float fov,
float aspectRatio,
float nearZ,
float farZ
) = 0

Sets the camera parameters

Parameters
fov
float

field of view in radians

aspectRatio
float

Camera's aspect ratio

nearZ
float

distance to near plane

farZ
float

distance to far plane

SetPosition
virtual void SetPosition(
Vector3 &eye,
Vector3 &look,
Vector3 &up
) = 0

Sets the camera's position.

Parameters
eye
Vector3&

camera's world position

look
Vector3&

camera's look point. Used to define the camera's view direction

up
Vector3&

camera's up point. The eye point and up point define the up vector.

GetPosition
virtual void GetPosition(
Vector3 *pEye,
Vector3 *pLook,
Vector3 *pUp,
Vector3 *pU,
Vector3 *pV,
Vector3 *pN
) = 0

Gets the camera's position.

Parameters
eye

returns the camera's world position. Maybe nullptr.

look

returns the camera's look point. Maybe nullptr.

up

returns the camera's up point. Maybe nullptr.

pU
Vector3*

Returns the camera's X axis. Maybe nullptr.

pV
Vector3*

Returns the camera's Y axis. Maybe nullptr.

pN
Vector3*

Returns the camera's Z axis. Maybe nullptr.

SetOffset
virtual void SetOffset(
Vector3 &offset
) = 0

Sets an offset that is applied to the camera's eye and look point.

Parameters
offset
Vector3&

offset to apply

GetOffset
virtual void GetOffset(
Vector3 &offset
) = 0

Returns the current offset

Parameters
offset
Vector3&

Returns the offset that is being applied to the camera's eye and look point

GetProjection
virtual DirectX::XMMATRIX GetProjection() = 0

Returns the camera's projection matrix

GetView
virtual DirectX::XMMATRIX GetView() = 0

Returns the camera's view matrix

GetNear
virtual float GetNear() = 0

Returns the camera's near plane distance

GetFar
virtual float GetFar() = 0

Returns the camera's far plane distance

GetUVN
virtual void GetUVN(
Vector3 *u,
Vector3 *v,
Vector3 *n
) = 0

Returns the camera axis in world coordinates

Parameters
u
Vector3*

X axis

v
Vector3*

Y axis

n
Vector3*

Z axis

CreateCamera
CAUSTICAPI CRefObj<ICamera> CreateCamera(
bool leftHanded
)

Global function for creating a camera. This method should generally not be called. Use the ICausticFactory to create new Caustic objects.

Parameters
leftHanded
bool

indicates whether we are creating a left handed coordinate system or a right handed coordinates system.

Returns

Returns the newly created camera.
